question: A 5 kg object is moving with a velocity of 2 m/s. What is its kinetic energy?
A force of 10 N is applied to an object, causing it to move 5 m. What is the work done on the object?
An object is moving in a circular path with a radius of 2 m and a velocity of 4 m/s. What is its centripetal acceleration?
A 10 kg object is dropped from a height of 5 m. What is its potential energy at the top?
A force of 20 N is applied to an object at an angle of 30°. What is the component of the force in the x-direction?
An object is moving with a velocity of 6 m/s and an acceleration of 2 m/s². What is its displacement after 3 s?
A 5 kg object is attached to a spring with a spring constant of 10 N/m. What is its frequency of oscillation?
A force of 30 N is applied to an object, causing it to move 10 m. What is the work done on the object if the force is applied at an angle of 60°?
An object is moving in a circular path with a radius of 3 m and a velocity of 6 m/s. What is its angular velocity?
A 10 kg object is moving with a velocity of 8 m/s. What is its momentum?
